summary: Worker fails with "Automatic publicPath is not supported in this browser" error when running compiled JavaScript via node, but works with ts-node. Root cause identified as third-party packages importing browser-specific modules into the workflow bundle.
userImpact: Workers fail to activate workflows in production Node.js environments when the workflow bundle contains browser-targeting dependencies.
rootCause: Third-party packages (e.g., @supabase/supabase-js) importing browser-specific modules that use Webpack's automatic publicPath feature, which is incompatible with Node.js VM execution context.
proposedFix: Use bundlerOptions.ignoreModules to exclude problematic packages from the workflow bundle.
workaround: Run workers with ts-node instead of compiled JavaScript, or exclude the offending NPM package using ignoreModules configuration.
resolutionDetails: Issue determined to be caused by user's workflow importing incompatible third-party packages. SDK behavior is correct; users must review and filter their workflow imports.
keyQuote: Your Workflow code is somehow importing an NPM package that uses Webpack's automatic publicPath feature. That feature only makes sense in a web app
